result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:48 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Armando Lara Nieto appeared by video La Crosse County Jail.  Attorney Brian William Severson appeared by video for Armando Lara Nieto.  Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter Monica Marin appears via zoom, Court reviews file and notes Ms. Marin was sworn in on 5/16/22 and is still under oath.  Atty Severson states DE would like to waive PH today.  Court finds Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to personal appearance for today's proceeding. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Court notes ADA Becker discussed having the ARGN today. Atty Severson agrees to ARGN today.  ADA Becker states information will be filed and the only change will be that each charge will include modifier. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on each count.  Not requesting a speedy trial.  DE has another matter in La Crosse County, hearing scheduled for early November.  Atty Severson requests next hearing to be scheduled after other matter is done.  Interpreter confirmed next hearing date.  If there is an agreement parties to appear in person or reschedule hearing.  Adjourned at 4:06 PM. bph
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by Atty Severson. arc
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 2, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Set for WOPH.  DE is not here, interpreter not needed for today's hearing.  JA to reach out to Interpreter and attorney's to coordinate a time to conduct waiver hearing via zoom.  Atty Severson states DE will be in custody until at least October. Adjourned at 3:17 PM. bph

per SRN. hml

Faxed to Dispatch, Quash Sheriff & Jail
Preliminary hearing on June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

- Surrender any passport to the Clerk of Court Office within 24 hours of release.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Emmanual S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device 50 mile restriction from Hudson. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: Liddle ADA: Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Brian William Severson   DF:  Armando Lara Nieto appeared from jail. Interpreter Monica Marin present. Oath of Interpreter given at 1:15 p.m. DE has a copy of complaint. Address and DOB confirmed. Atty Severson states DE is currently in custody in the LaCrosse County Jail. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Waives reading. Atty Severson waives time limits. Court QUASHES WARRANT. Court adjourned at 1:23 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
